analyzed: gzhan nyi ma la gnas pa'i hr'i:yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa /

analyzed: nyi ma la gnas pa'i rdo rje snying po la bdag nyid rdo rje phag mor bsgom par bya'o //

translated: From that, having generated all sentient beings as having become her form by the web of light rays from the seed syllable in the heart, they enter into oneself.

analyzed: bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo'o zhes pa'i nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i rjes la rang gi lte bar sna tshogs padma la nyi ma dkar dmar la hr'i:yig dkar por bltas la /
translated: After that, one should look at the white syllable hrīḥ on a white and red sun on a multicolored lotus in one’s navel.

original: de la sngags ni phreng ba'i rnam pa dkar po 'khor lo 'khor bzhin pa bzhin du sbyor bas zhal gyi sgo nas 'thon te /
analyzed: de la sngags ni phreng ba'i rnam pa dkar po 'khor lo 'khor bzhin pa bzhin du sbyor bas zhal gyi sgo nas 'thon te /
translated: The mantra in the form of a white rosary circles like a wheel and, through the application of that, emerges from the door of one’s mouth.

translated: Having summoned the hosts of qualities of the Buddha, the powers of jewels, mantras, medicines, the moon, stars, pictures, treatises, arts, and so forth, they enter the opening of the navel.

analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi mi shes pa thams cad bsreg par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on oneself as burning up all the ignorance of oneself and others.

translated: Then, having been properly incited by the light rays of the seed syllable in the heart, one should invite the awareness goddesses residing in space, facing in front,

translated: having made offerings with the hosts of goddesses previously mentioned, preceded by the offering to the deities, and having recited the mantra of the phaṁ syllable, one should bind the blazing mudra to the forehead.

analyzed: @232b g-yon du 'khor bzhin pas spyan drang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de dag gcig tu gyur pas bsgom zhing sngags kyis nga rgyal bya'o //

original: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di'o //

analyzed: aom yog buddha:sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham /
translated: Om yogabuddha, all dharmas are pure like yoga, I am.

analyzed: de la de'i sa bon gyis yang dag par bskul nas nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gdan drangs te /
translated: Then, having been summoned by its seed, the Tathagatas Akṣhobhya and so forth, who are in space, are invited.

original: de rnams kyis bdud rtsi lngar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bum pa rnams dang / der sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i rol mo dang rnga dang dung dang rdza rnga dang 'khar rnga dang pi wang dang gling bu dang glu dbyangs rnams dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bdud rtsi lngar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyi bum pa rnams dang / der sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i rol mo dang rnga dang dung dang rdza rnga dang 'khar rnga dang pi wang dang gling bu dang glu dbyangs rnams dang /
translated: They, with vases of the nature of the five Tathagatas, which are the five nectars, and with various emanations of music, and with drums, conches, clay drums, kettledrums, flutes, and songs,

original: lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyang ca co'i dpung gnyen rnams dang / gur gum dang ga bur dang gla rtsi dang dri bzangs me tog gi char 'bab pa dang / ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin rnams kyang ca co'i dpung gnyen rnams dang / gur gum dang ga bur dang gla rtsi dang dri bzangs me tog gi char 'bab pa dang / ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: just as soon as he was born,

original: de bzhin gshegs rnams khrus gsol ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rnams khrus gsol ba //
translated: the Tathāgatas bathed him,

original: lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
analyzed: lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
translated: with pure divine water.

original: de bzhin bdag kyang khrus bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag kyang khrus bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I should bathe.

original: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod pas bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod pas bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Reciting this verse, one should consecrate oneself.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta sa ma ya shri ye h'um zhes pa 'dis byin gyis brlab cing sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma la bzhugs pa'i mi bskyod pa dbu la bzhugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta sa ma ya shri ye h'um zhes pa 'dis byin gyis brlab cing sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma la bzhugs pa'i mi bskyod pa dbu la bzhugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: With Oṃ all tathāgatas, please confer the consecration, hūṃ, one should bless oneself and imagine Akṣobhya residing on one's head, seated on a variegated lotus and sun.

original: de nas de'i sprul pa rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis de la sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pa byas nas ji srid 'dod
analyzed: de nas de'i sprul pa rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis de la sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bdud rtsi myang ba la sogs pa byas nas ji srid 'dod
translated: Then, his emanations, the goddesses beginning with Caṇḍaroṣā, having worshipped him with various kinds of emanated offerings, having performed the tasting of nectar and so forth in the manner to be explained, should meditate as long as they wish.

original: kyi bar du bsam gtan byas nas spro ba dang bsdu ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas myur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi bar du bsam gtan byas nas spro ba dang bsdu ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas myur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having meditated, they should recite the mantra, preceded by the emanation and gathering in, free from the faults of speed and so forth.

original: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di'o //
translated: The mantra is this:

original: hri'i:gang gi tshe ldang bar 'dod na de'i sngags kyi phreng ba lte ba la gnas pa'i hr'i:yig la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: hri'i:gang gi tshe ldang bar 'dod na de'i sngags kyi phreng ba lte ba la gnas pa'i hr'i:yig la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: HRIH. When one wishes to rise, one should meditate on the mantra rosary on the HRIH located at the navel.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas smon lam btab ste yongs su bsngo ba byas nas yi ge brgya ba lan gsum brjod de lha mo'i nga rgyal gyis bya ba bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas smon lam btab ste yongs su bsngo ba byas nas yi ge brgya ba lan gsum brjod de lha mo'i nga rgyal gyis bya ba bya'o //
translated: Having performed the offerings and so forth, having made the aspiration and having performed the dedication, one should recite the one-hundred syllable mantra three times and perform the activities with the pride of the goddess.

original: chos thams cad kyang de la gnyis su med par blta zhing spyod lam ci bde bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de la gnyis su med par blta zhing spyod lam ci bde bar bya'o //
translated: One should also view all phenomena as nondual with it and act in whatever way is comfortable.

original: de la yi ge brgya pa'i sngags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yi ge brgya pa'i sngags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mantra of the hundred syllables is as follows:🔽Oṃ āḥ.

original: aom a'a:/ aom badzra satva sa ma ya /
analyzed: aom a'a:/ aom badzra satva sa ma ya /
translated: Oṃ vajrasattva samaya,

original: ma nu p'a la ya badzra satva tve no pa tishtha dri dho me bha wa su to shyo me bha ba su po shyo me bha ba aa nu rakto me bha ba /🔽sarba siddhim me @233a * //
analyzed: ma nu p'a la ya badzra satva tve no pa tishtha dri dho me bha wa su to shyo me bha ba su po shyo me bha ba aa nu rakto me bha ba / sarba siddhim me @233a * //
translated: maṇḍalaṃ, vajrasattva-tvam-upa-tiṣṭha, dṛḍho me bhava, sutoṣyo me bhava, suposyo me bhava, anurakto me bhava,

original: pra yatstsha sarba karma su tsa me tsittam shre ya:ku ru h'um ha ha ha ha ho:/
analyzed: pra yatstsha sarba karma su tsa me tsittam shre ya:ku ru h'um ha ha ha ha ho:/
translated: sarva-siddhiṃ me prayaccha, sarva-karma-suca me cittaṃ śreyaḥ kuru hūṃ ha ha ha ha hoḥ.

original: bha ga b'an sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra m'a me munytsa badzr'i bha wa ma h'a sa ma ya satva a'a:h'um zhes so //
analyzed: bha ga b'an sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra m'a me munytsa badzr'i bha wa ma h'a sa ma ya satva a'a:h'um zhes so //
translated: Bhagavān, sarva-tathāgata-vajra, mā me muñca, vajrī-bhava, mahā-samaya-sattva āḥ hūṃ.

original: thun mtshams rnams su yang skad cig gis lha mo'i rnam pa mngon du byas te mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgoms te sngon bzhin du sngags bzlas nas sngon ma bzhin du thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: thun mtshams rnams su yang skad cig gis lha mo'i rnam pa mngon du byas te mchod pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bsgoms te sngon bzhin du sngags bzlas nas sngon ma bzhin du thams cad bya'o //
translated: Having recited the mantra as before, one should do everything as before.

original: mtshan phyed kyi thun mtshams su yang thams cad byas nas nyal ba'i dus su spyi bor bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzhugs par bltas nas yang dag par mchod par bya'o ;
analyzed: mtshan phyed kyi thun mtshams su yang thams cad byas nas nyal ba'i dus su spyi bor bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzhugs par bltas nas yang dag par mchod par bya'o ;
translated: At the end of the session at midnight, having done everything, at the time of going to sleep, one should visualize the gurus, Buddhas, and Bodhisattvas residing on one’s crown, and one should make offerings to them.

original: / yan lag brgyad kyis phyag byas te nyal ba na seng ge'i nyal stabs kyis nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: / yan lag brgyad kyis phyag byas te nyal ba na seng ge'i nyal stabs kyis nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Having prostrated with the eight-part prostration, one should go to sleep in the sleeping posture of a lion.

original: de nas snga dro'i thun la lha mos gnyid rab tu bslang nas sngon bzhin du thams cad bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de nas snga dro'i thun la lha mos gnyid rab tu bslang nas sngon bzhin du thams cad bya'o zhes so //
translated: Then, in the morning session, the goddess should awaken one from sleep, and one should do everything as before.

original: yang na gang zhig rim pa 'dis sa phyogs 'ga' zhig tu ro'i gdan la skyil krung gis stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig rim pa 'dis sa phyogs 'ga' zhig tu ro'i gdan la skyil krung gis stan bde ba la nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: Or else, by this process, in some place on the ground, he should sit cross-legged on a seat of kusha grass, in a comfortable position.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rjes dmigs nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rjes dmigs nas /
translated: Having visualized compassion for all sentient beings,🔽he should perform the preliminaries, beginning with the confession of sins, up to the arousal of the thought of enlightenment.

original: sdig pa bshags pa nas brtsams te ji srid byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i bar du sngon du 'gro bas a'a:yig yongs su gyur pa las rang gi lce padma'i rnam pa la hr'i:yig 'bar zhing 'od gsal ba ji srid 'dod par bsgoms shing brtan par byas nas brgya
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa nas brtsams te ji srid byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i bar du sngon du 'gro bas a'a:yig yongs su gyur pa las rang gi lce padma'i rnam pa la hr'i:yig 'bar zhing 'od gsal ba ji srid 'dod par bsgoms shing brtan par byas nas brgya
translated: Then, having meditated on the letter A as transformed into a lotus, and on the letter HRIH as blazing and shining on the lotus of his tongue, he should stabilize it as long as he wishes.

original: phyed kyi phreng ba'i rdog po srad bu la brgyus nas thun gsum mam thun bzhir rnal 'byor pas bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: phyed kyi phreng ba'i rdog po srad bu la brgyus nas thun gsum mam thun bzhir rnal 'byor pas bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having strung the syllables of the mantra on a thread, like the beads of a rosary, the yogin should recite it in three or four sessions.

original: gnyid log pa na sngon gyi cho ga bzhin du nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyid log pa na sngon gyi cho ga bzhin du nyal bar bya'o //
translated: When he falls asleep, he should go to sleep as prescribed in the previous chapter.

original: de bzhin du bzlas pa dang bsgom pa cho ga bzhin du rjes su gnang bas 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad las nges par grol nas dad pa dang dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas shing brtse ba dang ldan pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gus par byas nas
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlas pa dang bsgom pa cho ga bzhin du rjes su gnang bas 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad las nges par grol nas dad pa dang dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas shing brtse ba dang ldan pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gus par byas nas
translated: Likewise, having been liberated from the eight worldly dharmas through the permission ritual of recitation and meditation, one should abide in faith, samaya, and vows, and with loving kindness, respect the spiritual friend.

original: / de'i phyi nas rnal 'byor pas 'bum phrag bdun bzlas pas bstan bcos dang sgyu rtsal gyi chos thams cad la rang gis mngon par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de'i phyi nas rnal 'byor pas 'bum phrag bdun bzlas pas bstan bcos dang sgyu rtsal gyi chos thams cad la rang gis mngon par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, the yogin should recite [the mantra] seven hundred thousand times. One will then have clairvoyance with respect to all treatises and arts.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa dang dpa' ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'khor gyis zil gyis mi non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa dang dpa' ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'khor gyis zil gyis mi non par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be endowed with wisdom, courage, fearlessness, and will not be overwhelmed by an assembly.

original: rgol ba bor yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgol ba bor yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be victorious in debate.

original: rims dang ngan thabs dang / dug dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs ba rnams kyis bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rims dang ngan thabs dang / dug dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs ba rnams kyis bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be harmed by epidemics, sorcery, poison, ḍākinīs, and so on.

original: gang zos pa de thams @233b cad kyang bdud rtsir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zos pa de thams @233b cad kyang bdud rtsir 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever one eats will become nectar.

original: 'di'i sngags bzlas pas dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sngags bzlas pas dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting this mantra, one will attain success.

original: 'di'i sngags kyis thod le kor la mngon par bsngags nas gang gi lag tu byin na blun po yang snyan ngag mkhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sngags kyis thod le kor la mngon par bsngags nas gang gi lag tu byin na blun po yang snyan ngag mkhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: By incanting a piece of chalk with this mantra, and giving it to someone to hold in their hand, even a fool will become a poet.

original: de'i dri tsam gyis kyang sbrul la sogs pa rnams nye nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i dri tsam gyis kyang sbrul la sogs pa rnams nye nus pa ma yin no //
translated: By the mere smell of it, snakes and so on will not be able to approach.

original: 'di rnams kyi bar du gcod pas bar chad byed pa rnams dang gzhan rnams kyi yang thams cad la phan par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi bar du gcod pas bar chad byed pa rnams dang gzhan rnams kyi yang thams cad la phan par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be able to ward off all obstacles and harms caused by obstacles, and also those of others.

original: bdag gis mang po smos pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gis mang po smos pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What need is there for me to say much?

original: bems po'i blo yang bstan bcos la nyon mongs par bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: bems po'i blo yang bstan bcos la nyon mongs par bya mi dgos te /
translated: Even a dull-witted person need not be troubled by treatises.

original: mi g-yo ba'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i sems kyis so //
translated: With an unwavering mind.

original: sngags 'di 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas na 'dis shes rab kyi snang ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sngags 'di 'bum phrag gnyis bzlas na 'dis shes rab kyi snang ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: By reciting this mantra two hundred thousand times, one will accomplish the illumination of wisdom.

original: 'dir yang gang zhig rnams kyis sems brtan par gyur pas yon tan mtha' yas pa gsungs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang zhig rnams kyis sems brtan par gyur pas yon tan mtha' yas pa gsungs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here too, by means of this mantra, one will attain the state of having immeasurable qualities.

original: de rnams kyis shin tu mchog gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis shin tu mchog gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: By these, one will attain the most excellent power.

original: shes rab kyi snang ba sgrub pa'i cho ga rdzogs so//
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba sgrub pa'i cho ga rdzogs so//
translated: The rite for accomplishing the light of wisdom is complete.
